description: There are different varieties to this dish, it's usually made with just cauliflower, called Gobi Manchurian. I also use broccoli.
name: Broccoli and Cauliflower Manchurian Recipe | Woolworths
recipeIngredient: 1 tbs garlic, paste or finely chopped

recipeInstructions.text: Chop and wash cauliflower and broccoli into large florets. I prep mine by chopping the florets and placing them in hot salted water for 5-10 mins. You don't have to do this. Then lightly cook the cauliflower and broccoli in a little salted water.
Get the spices ready and mix the dry spices all together with the garlic also.
Add some water and make into a thick paste and mix well. Add the cornflour and mix completely.
Now dip each broccoli and cauliflower floret into the marinade and put the dipped florets onto a plate. Allow to marinade for at least 10 minutes.

Add oil to fry pan or to deep pan for frying. I either shallow fry or deep fry, depending on what cooking I'm doing that day. Either is fine. This time, I shallow fried, if shallow frying, fry the florets separately and keep them separate so they don't stick together.

Fry the florets by turning them so that all sides cook fully and brown slightly. If you're deep frying, just put them in the oil, a few at a time and turn them around in the oil for a minute or so, then take out. That's it, now enjoy on their own or as a side dish.
